intro: Zeuxine sakagutii, commonly known as the Sakaguchi's zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
